intro: Calorophus ater, commonly known as the black flame flower, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in hot, dry climates. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black velvety leaves and clusters of bright orange to red tubular flowers. Its unique coloration and striking appearance make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Calorophus ater is also noted for its ability to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in challenging environments.
